lines.content: This is a project template for a greenfield Java project. It's named after Tony Stack's intelligent personal assistant Jarvis. Given below are instructions on how to use it.
Prerequisites: JDK 17, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project first)
1. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. Configure the project to use **JDK 17** (not other versions) as explained in [here](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/sdk.html#set-up-jdk).
In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.

1. After that, locate the `src/main/java/Jarvis.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run Jarvis.main()` (if the code editor is showing compile errors, try restarting the IDE). If the setup is correct, you should see something like the below as the output:
What can I do for you?
Bye. Hope to see you again soon!

**Warning:** Keep the `src\main\java` folder as the root folder for Java files (i.e., don't rename those folders or move Java files to another folder outside of this folder path), as this is the default location some tools (e.g., Gradle) expect to find Java files.
Jarvis Level-6 is an intelligent chatbot that helps you keep track of your tasks.
It supports todos, deadlines, and events, and lets you mark tasks as done or not done.
Run the app (`Jarvis.java`), then type commands into the terminal as standard input.
## Below are what you can ask Jarvis Level-6 to do
### Add an item, as one of following three categories:
Use `todo DESCRIPTION` to add a todo.
Got it. I've added this task:
Now you have 1 task in the list.
Use `deadline DESCRIPTION /by TIME` to add a deadline.
Got it. I've added this task:
Now you have 2 tasks in the list.
Use `event DESCRIPTION /from START /to END` to add an event.
Got it. I've added this task:
Now you have 3 tasks in the list.
Use `list` to ask Jarvis Level-6 to show all stored items, numbered from `INDEX` 1.
Here are the tasks in your list:
Use `mark INDEX` to mark the task at `INDEX` as done.
Nice! I've marked this task as done:
### Mark a task as not done
Use `unmark INDEX` to mark the task at `INDEX` as not done.
OK, I've marked this task as not done yet:
Bye. Hope to see you again soon!
## Jarvis Level-6 are also built to handle errors
If user enter an invalid command or an invalid format, Jarvis Level-6 prints an error message instead of crashing. It handles two type of errors as follows:
The description of a todo cannot be empty.
Sorry, I don't know what that means. Valid command starts with: todo, deadline, event, list, mark, unmark, bye.
## Delete task is also available in Jarvis Level-6
Use `delete INDEX` to remove the task at `INDEX`.
Now you have 5 tasks in the list.
* Represents a task that needs to be done before a specific time.
* Creates a deadline with the given description and deadline time.
* Represents a task that starts at a specific time and ends at a specific time.
* Constructor to create an event with the given description, start time, and end time
